pr_title: ActiveMQ Default XPath evaluator could not be loaded

timeline.bodyText: Hm... this sounds like they could be made to work if one adds the necessary libs. But it is obviously not true due to the substitution. Wouldn't something like "We have explicitly disabled ActiveMQ https://activemq.apache.org/selectors.html[XPath selectors] in the native mode because they would not work anyway, because of [the reason]" be more honest from us?
timeline.author: ppalaga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,2 @@
+ActiveMQ https://activemq.apache.org/selectors.html[XPath selectors] are not supported in native mode as the libraries to support it are not on the classpath
+by default.

replies.bodyText:
Well, it would require adding activemq-broker to the classpath. Which is not something we want to support, and wont work natively by default (which is why we exclude it from the dep tree).
I can add a comment to that affect.
replies.author: jamesnetherton

timeline.message:
ActiveMQ Default XPath evaluator could not be loaded

Fixes #1933

ActiveMQ Default XPath evaluator could not be loaded

Fixes #1933
